summary: I want a really angsty irondad fic.
title: I want a really angsty irondad fic.
body:
So, we all know the typical trope of Flash bullying Peter about not knowing Tony Stark. I want an angsty post endgame fic, where Flash says something to Peter about Tony, and Peter Flips. I read one like this on AO3 and loved it.

Even better, the typical Field Trip trope, post Tony’s death!

summary: WAIT UP... TONY ACTUALLY CANONLY CONSIDERS HIMSELF PETER PARKER’S DAD !!! - So I’m rewatching Homecoming, and there’s this...
body:
WAIT UP… TONY ACTUALLY CANONLY CONSIDERS HIMSELF PETER PARKER’S DAD !!!

-

So I’m rewatching Homecoming, and there’s this particular scene:

So, Peter is on the boat, trying to stop the bad guys, and then Tony calls him in the middle of his investigation.

Peter’s lying to him saying he’s at school (of course), but it’s what Tony says that’s important !

-

Script:

Tony: “Nice work in DC. My dad never really gave me a lot of support, and I’m just trying to break the cycle of shame.”

Peter: “Uh, I’m kind of in the middle of something…”

Tony: “Don’t cut me off when I’m complimenting you.”

-

He’s trying to break the cycle of bad parenting from his parents to be a good parent to Peter! He uses the word “dad” and “breaking the family cycle” while talking to Peter, saying he wants to be a better father than his father!

It’s canon!

(It’s at 1h13min30sec in the movie, if you want to watch the scene yourself.)

blog.name: kaytikitty
blog.title: Multi Fandom
blog.description: she/her, Bisexual, writer, Cat person. TUA, Sanders Sides, Marvel, BBS, Sidemen, Harry Potter. taking requests/prompts #KaytiKittyFanfics for writing. All prompts/concepts I post are open for others to write, I only ask that you tag me.

body:
The Rouge Avengers

I was having the worst night. It couldn’t be denied. I bet no superhero ever had to ditch his homecoming date to go fight her supervillain father and then rescue him after he blew himself up.

     I was out of web fluid so I had to walk through alleyways to get home without being seen. I couldn’t breathe properly through my mask which was stuffed in my pocket. It was really not my night.

*Switches to third person POV halfway through because fuck it*

     The sound of grunting from a nearby alleyway hit my ears. Multiple people were crying and it sounded like a fight was happening. Peter couldn’t do much with burns covering his skin, cuts leaking blood, and bones that were guaranteed to be fractured. But Peter had a better chance of fighting these guys off then regular people.

     He slipped his mask back on, steadied himself on the wall while he took a deep breath than rushed forward. “Hey! Didn’t you ever hear it wasn’t nice to pick on people?”

     Peter tried to keep his voice from showing how purely exhausted he was, he tried to be sarcastic and his usual peppy self. A family were the victims, a dad, mom and three kids. He was normally a big crowd pleaser when it came to children, loving to play with them or show them cool tricks to calm them down. He even had selfies circulating the internet of him posing with Children he had helped.

      This family didn’t look nearly happy to see him but he couldn’t stress on ot because the robbers were talking to him, saying words much to vile to repeat and threatening the father.

      A gun was pulled from one of the men’s waistband and aimed for the man. Peter reacted quick, without thought, throwing himself at the man closet to him. The guy with the gun aimed at Peter and pulled the trigger. The bullet found a target, burying itself in the soft flesh of Peter’s shoulder.

       Peter grunted. “Go!” Peter yelled at the woman who was standing there with her children. “Go! Now!” The woman cradled the youngest boy into her chest and ran for it, the little girl and boy runn behind her.

       Peter didn’t have time to watch as the gunman took a shot at the family, instead he kicked the hand holding the weapon. The bullet buried itself into a trash bag and the gun flew across the alley.

       Peter felt his body give out before he registered the kick that swept his legs from under us. “Aw, the famous Spiderman taken out by a couple of lowlife muggers.” One of the men teased.

      Peter’s head was swimming. “If I could get taken out that easy then that inspirational poster would be a real waste.”

       The quip sucked, Peter knew it but hopefully it would distract them enough that he could come up with a plan. Any plan really. If he had his suit right now Karen would know what to do. He really wishes he had Karen right now.

       One of the muggers kicked Peter hard in the side. Peter grabbed the man’s foot and pulled. He jumped up as the man went down and threw the dead weight at the man’s companions.

       One of the men jumped out of the way. Peter turned to face his last opponent only to find him unconscious, held up by his collar in the hands of Hawkeye.

        “I knew it was suspicious for Tony to set up a date with my family.” Hawkeye said angrily. Peter was to tired to focus on what he meant. His shoulder hurt, his head hurt and for some reason the ringing in his ears was getting louder.

      “I don’t think Mr. Stark would try to mug you,” Peter thought about what he said. “He wouldn’t. If he did he wouldn’t hire people to do it either.”

      Hawkeye scoffed. “You expect me to believe it’s a coincidence that the Spider Kid from Germany just so happens to be where Tony told me to be?”

      Peter couldn’t really decipher what the man was saying, except for Mr. Stark knew that Hawkeye was here. “Don’t tell Mr. Stark.” His words came out slurred.

      Hawkeye growled and raised his bow. Peter would have jumped if he had the energy. “I don’t want to be shot again. I’ll have to miss school at this rate.”

       Hawkeye hesitated. “School? How old are you kid?”

        “Man… I’m….a… m-” Peter cut himself off as he crashed to the ground. Hawkeye didn’t know what to do as he started at the collapsed vigilante.

       It wasn’t until Hawkeye thought back on what he said that Clint realized the kid said shot again. Again. Clint looked at him this time, noticing the blood soaking through fabric, the soot covered skin visible through tears. The bullet wound in  his shoulder. The bullet wound the kid got from saving his family.

       “Crap,” Clint said out loud. He was glad when Bucky and sam showed up to help him fight off the vigilante.

       “Laura told us you got mugged and insect boy showed up.” Sam looked at where Peter lay. A dizzy mumble came from the boy’s lips.

      “Arachnid.” Bucky snorted at the, apparently, half conscious kid.

      Peter woke up what felt like days later. He was in a place he didn’t recognize and he felt slightly off. His spider sense wasn’t going off but he felt eyes watching him.

     Peter turned around to see his mask laying on the floor nearby, a soft giggle sounded when he went to stand up. Peter jerked up and looked around.

      The little girl from the alleyway was peeking at him from around the corner. Peter smiled softly. “Well hi there.”

       The girl seemed unsure of herself as she came fully into the room. She seemed extremely shy and Peter felt himself easing more into a comfortable situation. “I’m Peter, what’s your name?”

      The girl didn’t answer the question, asking one of her own. “Why did you fight my daddy with the mean kitty man?”

      Peter just smiled, not knowing how to answer the question. His brain was still fighting to put everything together and not freak out about his identity being revealed.

      “There were papers that wanted to hurt people like daddy and uncle Bucky and you wanted to.”

       Peter’s eyes widened in understanding. Hawkeye being in the alley, him talking about his family, Mr. Stark setting him up.

    Peter knew that Mr. Stark so desperately missed his avengers family and that he would never set them up. Clearly there was still trust issues going on there.

     Peter suddenly felt his spidey sense go off. It was very numb, it didn’t say immediate danger but there was a sense of unease. “Hey, kid? Where are we?”

     The kid frowned. “At our safehouse.”

   The words seemed to echo for a moment as Peter recalled the memory. Mr. Stark and Ross arguing this morning, arguing about Clint Barton, about hidden shield records, about a secret.

    The secret family who stayed in the secret safehouse. The safehouse that Riss had found out about. Peter swooped down to grab his mask off the ground. His wounds still stung when he moved but it was bearable thank to his healing factor.

     “Where’s your dad?” Peter demanded the girl to tell him. The little girl frowned and crossed her arms. Peter held back a sigh. They thought he was a bad guy. Great.

      “Alright, I know you think I’m a bad guy but I don’t want to hurt you or your da-” Peter got cut off as his spider sense went through the roof.

     Peter hauled the girl up into his shoulder, she screamed as Peter ran down the stairs with her. As he turned the corner on the last step he was alerted in time to barely dodge a metal fist swung his way.

   “Dude, What the fu-fudge?” Peter remembered the children’s presence last minute and changed his wording. As he was staring at the Winter Soldier, he was attacked from behind by Black Widow.

  The girl that Peter was carrying jumped down and started to run towards her mother and Hawkeye.

     Peter almost wanted to scream at them as he flipped onto the ceiling. Just as he was about to tell off the avengers attacking him he felt a sharp spike. He looked to see the girl he had been holding running past a window, the sound of a silenced gun going off had Peter moving.

    None of the others could hear it, but Peter could. He would not let anyone get shot but him, and maybe the Winter Solider.

    He dropped down and grabbed the girl, pulling her against his chest. The sound of a window shattering was all he heard before the bullet pierced his back.

    It was much to close to his spine for Peter to brush it off. He could have been paralyzed. He grunted and shoved the little girl towards Hawkeye, her father.

    “Get them out. I should be able to buy you a few minutes, I need you all out by then,” Peter’s voice was straining with the effort. He flexed his hands, checking his web shooters. Then he took a deep breath and spun to face the window.

     He barely heard the other Avengers screaming at him to wait before he launched through the window. The glass scrapped him, leaving small ribbons on blood across his sliced skin. He shot a web above where he thought the sniper was and pulled with all his might.

    His feet collided with the shoulders of the sniper and caused the man to fly back against another tree. He heard more guns being loaded.

     He took a deep breath, realizing that this was a fight he wouldn’t win. If only he had Karen and his suit, she would know what to do. She would at least have a plan or a way to call Mr. Stark.

    No, Peter didn’t need the suit but it sure would help. Peter spun, his bullet wound seemed to rip open even more and a waterfall of blood fell down his back, and shot a web at two guns. He yanked and the rifles flew to his hands.

    He used the butt of one gun to knock one agent out and then flipped over the other agent. He could feel sticky blood dripping down his back but the pain had seemed to flare before a numb sensation took over.

    Peter knew that really wasn’t good but he was mostly thankful for not being able to feel it, especially not when another bullet made his way through his thigh.

    With a scream of pain Peter fell to the ground. He raised his arm and shot a web up into the air. It was nothing but luck that the web struck something solid and Peter pulled himself away from the agents.

    He looked down in time to see a bullet strike the ground right where his head used to be.

    Peter was pissed off. They had shot to kill him. They shot a bullet at a child. They were sent here to kill the rogue avengers and anyone who got in there way. Peter hated Ross but now he actually found himself wishing for the man to rot away. 

    With a calming breath Peter prepared to jump down and face the agents once more. Before he could a hand snaked around his mouth.

     “Hush.” The voice was familiar. Peter nodded and was released. Hawkeye aimed his bow and had all the agents on the ground in a span of seconds. “Tranquilizers,” he spoke.

      Pete nodded, his vision was blurry and the tree seemed to sway. “Come on, Kid. We need to get you to Stark.”

      “Mr. Stark is going to be so upset with me,” Peter groaned. Hawkeye snorted, a sound that was half amusement and half distress.

      “Kid, if he isn’t proud of you then he’ll have a talk with the business end of my arrows.”

      Peter grinned. His eyes slipped shut and he felt the wind rush past him. The same way it felt when he was swinging over the city. Calming, peaceful, free.

     He woke up several days later. He was hooked to more machines then he could count. The room was familiar this time, at least, and Peter called out to Friday.

     As soon as Mr. Stark walked in the door Peter knew he was right. Mr. Stark was upset and he was in for a long lecture.

    Peter was pissed off. They had shot to kill him. They shot a bullet at a child. They were sent here to kill the rogue avengers and anyone who got in there way. Peter hated Ross but now he actually found himself wishing for the man to rot away. 

    With a calming breath Peter prepared to jump down and face the agents once more. Before he could a hand snaked around his mouth.

     “Hush.” The voice was familiar. Peter nodded and was released. Hawkeye aimed his bow and had all the agents on the ground in a span of seconds. “Tranquilizers,” he spoke.

      Pete nodded, his vision was blurry and the tree seemed to sway. “Come on, Kid. We need to get you to Stark.”

      “Mr. Stark is going to be so upset with me,” Peter groaned. Hawkeye snorted, a sound that was half amusement and half distress.

      “Kid, if he isn’t proud of you then he’ll have a talk with the business end of my arrows.”

      Peter grinned. His eyes slipped shut and he felt the wind rush past him. The same way it felt when he was swinging over the city. Calming, peaceful, free.

     He woke up several days later. He was hooked to more machines then he could count. The room was familiar this time, at least, and Peter called out to Friday.

     As soon as Mr. Stark walked in the door Peter knew he was right. Mr. Stark was upset and he was in for a long lecture.

trail.content_raw:
The Rouge Avengers

I was having the worst night. It couldn’t be denied. I bet no superhero ever had to ditch his homecoming date to go fight her supervillain father and then rescue him after he blew himself up.

     I was out of web fluid so I had to walk through alleyways to get home without being seen. I couldn’t breathe properly through my mask which was stuffed in my pocket. It was really not my night.

*Switches to third person POV halfway through because fuck it*

     The sound of grunting from a nearby alleyway hit my ears. Multiple people were crying and it sounded like a fight was happening. Peter couldn’t do much with burns covering his skin, cuts leaking blood, and bones that were guaranteed to be fractured. But Peter had a better chance of fighting these guys off then regular people.

     He slipped his mask back on, steadied himself on the wall while he took a deep breath than rushed forward. “Hey! Didn’t you ever hear it wasn’t nice to pick on people?”

     Peter tried to keep his voice from showing how purely exhausted he was, he tried to be sarcastic and his usual peppy self. A family were the victims, a dad, mom and three kids. He was normally a big crowd pleaser when it came to children, loving to play with them or show them cool tricks to calm them down. He even had selfies circulating the internet of him posing with Children he had helped.

      This family didn’t look nearly happy to see him but he couldn’t stress on ot because the robbers were talking to him, saying words much to vile to repeat and threatening the father.

      A gun was pulled from one of the men’s waistband and aimed for the man. Peter reacted quick, without thought, throwing himself at the man closet to him. The guy with the gun aimed at Peter and pulled the trigger. The bullet found a target, burying itself in the soft flesh of Peter’s shoulder.

       Peter grunted. “Go!” Peter yelled at the woman who was standing there with her children. “Go! Now!” The woman cradled the youngest boy into her chest and ran for it, the little girl and boy runn behind her.

       Peter didn’t have time to watch as the gunman took a shot at the family, instead he kicked the hand holding the weapon. The bullet buried itself into a trash bag and the gun flew across the alley.

       Peter felt his body give out before he registered the kick that swept his legs from under us. “Aw, the famous Spiderman taken out by a couple of lowlife muggers.” One of the men teased.

      Peter’s head was swimming. “If I could get taken out that easy then that inspirational poster would be a real waste.”

       The quip sucked, Peter knew it but hopefully it would distract them enough that he could come up with a plan. Any plan really. If he had his suit right now Karen would know what to do. He really wishes he had Karen right now.

       One of the muggers kicked Peter hard in the side. Peter grabbed the man’s foot and pulled. He jumped up as the man went down and threw the dead weight at the man’s companions.

       One of the men jumped out of the way. Peter turned to face his last opponent only to find him unconscious, held up by his collar in the hands of Hawkeye.

        “I knew it was suspicious for Tony to set up a date with my family.” Hawkeye said angrily. Peter was to tired to focus on what he meant. His shoulder hurt, his head hurt and for some reason the ringing in his ears was getting louder.

      “I don’t think Mr. Stark would try to mug you,” Peter thought about what he said. “He wouldn’t. If he did he wouldn’t hire people to do it either.”

      Hawkeye scoffed. “You expect me to believe it’s a coincidence that the Spider Kid from Germany just so happens to be where Tony told me to be?”

      Peter couldn’t really decipher what the man was saying, except for Mr. Stark knew that Hawkeye was here. “Don’t tell Mr. Stark.” His words came out slurred.

      Hawkeye growled and raised his bow. Peter would have jumped if he had the energy. “I don’t want to be shot again. I’ll have to miss school at this rate.”

       Hawkeye hesitated. “School? How old are you kid?”

        “Man… I’m….a… m-” Peter cut himself off as he crashed to the ground. Hawkeye didn’t know what to do as he started at the collapsed vigilante.

       It wasn’t until Hawkeye thought back on what he said that Clint realized the kid said shot again. Again. Clint looked at him this time, noticing the blood soaking through fabric, the soot covered skin visible through tears. The bullet wound in  his shoulder. The bullet wound the kid got from saving his family.

       “Crap,” Clint said out loud. He was glad when Bucky and sam showed up to help him fight off the vigilante.

       “Laura told us you got mugged and insect boy showed up.” Sam looked at where Peter lay. A dizzy mumble came from the boy’s lips.

      “Arachnid.” Bucky snorted at the, apparently, half conscious kid.

      Peter woke up what felt like days later. He was in a place he didn’t recognize and he felt slightly off. His spider sense wasn’t going off but he felt eyes watching him.

     Peter turned around to see his mask laying on the floor nearby, a soft giggle sounded when he went to stand up. Peter jerked up and looked around.

      The little girl from the alleyway was peeking at him from around the corner. Peter smiled softly. “Well hi there.”

       The girl seemed unsure of herself as she came fully into the room. She seemed extremely shy and Peter felt himself easing more into a comfortable situation. “I’m Peter, what’s your name?”

      The girl didn’t answer the question, asking one of her own. “Why did you fight my daddy with the mean kitty man?”

      Peter just smiled, not knowing how to answer the question. His brain was still fighting to put everything together and not freak out about his identity being revealed.

      “There were papers that wanted to hurt people like daddy and uncle Bucky and you wanted to.”

       Peter’s eyes widened in understanding. Hawkeye being in the alley, him talking about his family, Mr. Stark setting him up.

    Peter knew that Mr. Stark so desperately missed his avengers family and that he would never set them up. Clearly there was still trust issues going on there.

     Peter suddenly felt his spidey sense go off. It was very numb, it didn’t say immediate danger but there was a sense of unease. “Hey, kid? Where are we?”

     The kid frowned. “At our safehouse.”

   The words seemed to echo for a moment as Peter recalled the memory. Mr. Stark and Ross arguing this morning, arguing about Clint Barton, about hidden shield records, about a secret.

    The secret family who stayed in the secret safehouse. The safehouse that Riss had found out about. Peter swooped down to grab his mask off the ground. His wounds still stung when he moved but it was bearable thank to his healing factor.

     “Where’s your dad?” Peter demanded the girl to tell him. The little girl frowned and crossed her arms. Peter held back a sigh. They thought he was a bad guy. Great.

      “Alright, I know you think I’m a bad guy but I don’t want to hurt you or your da-” Peter got cut off as his spider sense went through the roof.

     Peter hauled the girl up into his shoulder, she screamed as Peter ran down the stairs with her. As he turned the corner on the last step he was alerted in time to barely dodge a metal fist swung his way.

   “Dude, What the fu-fudge?” Peter remembered the children’s presence last minute and changed his wording. As he was staring at the Winter Soldier, he was attacked from behind by Black Widow.

  The girl that Peter was carrying jumped down and started to run towards her mother and Hawkeye.

     Peter almost wanted to scream at them as he flipped onto the ceiling. Just as he was about to tell off the avengers attacking him he felt a sharp spike. He looked to see the girl he had been holding running past a window, the sound of a silenced gun going off had Peter moving.

    None of the others could hear it, but Peter could. He would not let anyone get shot but him, and maybe the Winter Solider.

    He dropped down and grabbed the girl, pulling her against his chest. The sound of a window shattering was all he heard before the bullet pierced his back.

    It was much to close to his spine for Peter to brush it off. He could have been paralyzed. He grunted and shoved the little girl towards Hawkeye, her father.

    “Get them out. I should be able to buy you a few minutes, I need you all out by then,” Peter’s voice was straining with the effort. He flexed his hands, checking his web shooters. Then he took a deep breath and spun to face the window.

     He barely heard the other Avengers screaming at him to wait before he launched through the window. The glass scrapped him, leaving small ribbons on blood across his sliced skin. He shot a web above where he thought the sniper was and pulled with all his might.

    His feet collided with the shoulders of the sniper and caused the man to fly back against another tree. He heard more guns being loaded.

     He took a deep breath, realizing that this was a fight he wouldn’t win. If only he had Karen and his suit, she would know what to do. She would at least have a plan or a way to call Mr. Stark.

    No, Peter didn’t need the suit but it sure would help. Peter spun, his bullet wound seemed to rip open even more and a waterfall of blood fell down his back, and shot a web at two guns. He yanked and the rifles flew to his hands.

    He used the butt of one gun to knock one agent out and then flipped over the other agent. He could feel sticky blood dripping down his back but the pain had seemed to flare before a numb sensation took over.

    Peter knew that really wasn’t good but he was mostly thankful for not being able to feel it, especially not when another bullet made his way through his thigh.

    With a scream of pain Peter fell to the ground. He raised his arm and shot a web up into the air. It was nothing but luck that the web struck something solid and Peter pulled himself away from the agents.

    He looked down in time to see a bullet strike the ground right where his head used to be.

    Peter was pissed off. They had shot to kill him. They shot a bullet at a child. They were sent here to kill the rogue avengers and anyone who got in there way. Peter hated Ross but now he actually found himself wishing for the man to rot away. 

    With a calming breath Peter prepared to jump down and face the agents once more. Before he could a hand snaked around his mouth.

     “Hush.” The voice was familiar. Peter nodded and was released. Hawkeye aimed his bow and had all the agents on the ground in a span of seconds. “Tranquilizers,” he spoke.

      Pete nodded, his vision was blurry and the tree seemed to sway. “Come on, Kid. We need to get you to Stark.”

      “Mr. Stark is going to be so upset with me,” Peter groaned. Hawkeye snorted, a sound that was half amusement and half distress.

      “Kid, if he isn’t proud of you then he’ll have a talk with the business end of my arrows.”

      Peter grinned. His eyes slipped shut and he felt the wind rush past him. The same way it felt when he was swinging over the city. Calming, peaceful, free.

     He woke up several days later. He was hooked to more machines then he could count. The room was familiar this time, at least, and Peter called out to Friday.

     As soon as Mr. Stark walked in the door Peter knew he was right. Mr. Stark was upset and he was in for a long lecture.

       It wasn’t until Hawkeye thought back on what he said that Clint realized the kid said shot again. Again. Clint looked at him this time, noticing the blood soaking through fabric, the soot covered skin visible through tears. The bullet wound in  his shoulder. The bullet wound the kid got from saving his family.

       “Crap,” Clint said out loud. He was glad when Bucky and sam showed up to help him fight off the vigilante.

tags: And I could get behind it.
But only if she gets redeemed and if Spider Man plays a role.
summary: I would only accept a Villain-Morgan story if:
title: I would only accept a Villain-Morgan story if:
body:
1. She was the main villain in Spider Man.
  2. She is a serious bad ass threat.
  3. It is Peter who manages to get through to her.
  4. He does so by talking about Tony and what he would have wanted for her (also talking about how he sees Morgan as a little sister, and that he can’t stand the idea of letting her - or Tony - down by letting her continue down this path).
  5. She then becomes a redeemed hero.
  6. It ends with her getting her own film series set right after.

blog.description: Mr. Merenda is a high school science teacher bringing you Fun Facts from comics, movies, TV, video games, and more every weekday!  He also boasts an impressive collection of over 500 TIES, which along with his many collectibles, are on display for you right here!

summary:
Join

blog.name: marvel-cast-dvr-alerts
blog.title: Marvel Cast Promotional DVR Alerts
blog.description:
Here you will find promotional DVR alerts for cast member talk show appearances and media shows press junket interviews for upcoming Marvel films.

You can also find updates on the Facebook page here:

https://www.facebook.com/MarvelCastDVRAlerts

You may also follow my Chris Evans/Marvel blog here:

http://moviefanjen.tumblr.com
